MS MCQs

    Share Power Automate buttons

    »

    1. Can an end user whom a flow button has been shared with share it with someone else?

      An end user can’t share the button flow. Only the flow owner can share a button flow.

      An end user can share the button only if they are a co-owner.

      An end user can share the button only if they have administrator rights.

      An end user can share the button with users in the same tenant.


    2. How can you share a button flow?

      Only by using your computer and accessing the Power Automate site

      By using the Power Automate site and the mobile app

      Only by using the mobile app

      By using the mobile app or the tablet app


    3. True or False. Run-only users will always have access to the connectors.

      False. Run-only users will never have access to connectors.

      True. Run-only users can access all connectors that the maker has.

      False. Run-only users will not have access to connectors outside the flow.

      True. Any users can access all connectors that are available in their tenant.


    4. With whom can a flow button be shared?

      Users, security groups, or Office 365 groups

      Other users only

      Office 365 groups only

      Security groups only


    5. Can a user remove a shared button flow?

      A user can remove a shared button flow.

      A user can’t remove a shared button flow.

      Only a button flow owner or co-owner can remove a button flow from a user’s account.

      After a button has been shared, it can never be removed by anyone unless the button is deleted globally.
